moves.1. e4 e5: Still best by test even today.
moves.3. Bc4 Qh4+: La Bourdonnais wastes no time getting his counterattack going.
moves.4. Kf1 d6: Opening a line for his QB to join the fray.
moves.6. Qd3 Nc6: Preparing to castle into safety on the Q-side.
moves.7. Bxf7+ Kxf7: McDonnell has prevented the castling, but at the cost of a piece.
moves.8. Qb3+ Kg6: Seeking shelter amidst the clutter on the K-side.
moves.9. Qxb7 Nxd4: Sacrificing a Rook to advance his counterattack and put the White Queen out of play.
moves.10. Qxa8 Nf6: Calling up more reserves. La Bourdonnais now has 4 pieces in play to McDonnell's one.
moves.11. Na3 f3: Opening up more space around the White King.
moves.15. Qxa7 Nc6: Keeping the White Queen away from the action.
moves.16. Qxc7 d4: Moving a defender out of the way.
moves.20. Kc1 Qxh1+: With mate to follow. McDonnell resigns here.

players: Alexander McDonnell  vs. Louis Charles Mahe de la Bourdonnais
